Pre-Game Insights: Argentina and Ecuador will go head-to-head on Sunday evening in what will be their first warm-up match before the Copa America 2024.
Lionel Messi and his teammates are aiming to win another Copa America title, following their victory in the World Cup held in Qatar in 2022.
Argentina is widely regarded as the top contender for the tournament, with Brazil also considered a strong contender.
Scaloni has the luxury of having both Julian Alvarez and Lautaro Martinez available for selection this summer.
Ecuador possesses a wealth of talent that could potentially pose a challenge for Argentina, with Enner Valencia, Moises Caicedo, and Piero Hincapie forming a formidable core.
Valencia, Ecuador’s all-time leading goal scorer, will be the key player to make a significant impact.
Argentina has a win probability of 65%, whereas Ecuador has a win probability of 20%, and the possibility of Extra Time is 15%.
